abstract: A Boolean value that indicates whether the tracked progress is indeterminate.

codeExamples.code:
let progress = Progress(totalUnitCount: 0) 
progress.completedUnitCount = 0 // default 
print("totalUnitCount: (progress.totalUnitCount)") 
print("completedUnitCount: (progress.completedUnitCount)") 
print("isIndeterminate: (progress.isIndeterminate)") 
print("fractionCompleted: (progress.fractionCompleted)") 
print("isFinished: (progress.isFinished)")
/*
Code Output:
totalUnitCount: 0 completedUnitCount: 0 isIndeterminate: true fractionCompleted: 0.0 isFinished: false
*/

overview:
## Discussion

Use [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/Progress/isIndeterminate] progress only when you’re unable to determine a reasonable value for either [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/Progress/completedUnitCount] or [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/Progress/totalUnitCount]. Progress is indeterminate when the value of the [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/Progress/totalUnitCount] or [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/Progress/completedUnitCount] is less than zero or if both values are zero. When progress is indeterminate, [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/Progress/fractionCompleted] returns `0.0` and [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/Progress/isFinished] returns `false`.

By default, [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/Progress] is KVO-compliant for this property. It sends notifications on the same thread that updates the property.

The following code snippet clarifies the behavior for setting both [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/Progress/totalUnitCount] and [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/Progress/completedUnitCount] to `0`.

# isIndeterminate

**Instance Property**

A Boolean value that indicates whether the tracked progress is indeterminate.

## Declaration

```swift
var isIndeterminate: Bool { get }
```

## Discussion

Use [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/Progress/isIndeterminate] progress only when you’re unable to determine a reasonable value for either [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/Progress/completedUnitCount] or [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/Progress/totalUnitCount]. Progress is indeterminate when the value of the [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/Progress/totalUnitCount] or [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/Progress/completedUnitCount] is less than zero or if both values are zero. When progress is indeterminate, [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/Progress/fractionCompleted] returns `0.0` and [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/Progress/isFinished] returns `false`.

By default, [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/Progress] is KVO-compliant for this property. It sends notifications on the same thread that updates the property.

The following code snippet clarifies the behavior for setting both [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/Progress/totalUnitCount] and [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/Progress/completedUnitCount] to `0`.

```swift
let progress = Progress(totalUnitCount: 0) 
progress.completedUnitCount = 0 // default 
print("totalUnitCount: (progress.totalUnitCount)") 
print("completedUnitCount: (progress.completedUnitCount)") 
print("isIndeterminate: (progress.isIndeterminate)") 
print("fractionCompleted: (progress.fractionCompleted)") 
print("isFinished: (progress.isFinished)")
/*
Code Output:
totalUnitCount: 0 completedUnitCount: 0 isIndeterminate: true fractionCompleted: 0.0 isFinished: false
*/
```

## Observing Progress

- **fractionCompleted**: The fraction of the overall work that the progress object completes, including work from its suboperations.
- **isFinished**: A Boolean value that indicates the progress object is complete.
